intro: Phaca sericea, commonly known as the silky phaca, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves covered in fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phaca sericea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
